title.narrative: Improving Conditions for Ecotourism in Kvareli Municipality

description.narrative: The Improving Conditions for Ecotourism in Kvareli Municipality Project will provide 20 riding horses to the Khideosi-2009 Foundation for horse trekking ecotourism activities, improving the economic conditions of 40 families and 100 individuals. Heifer Georgia will implement the project in five communities of Kvareli municipality (Gremi, Shilda, Eniseli, Sabue and Almati), where corresponding horse trekking routes are already established and marked. In the first year of the project, 15 pregnant riding horse mares will be given to 15 families interested in ecotourism and horse trekking. In the second year, five additional families will join the project. During the third and fourth years of the project, original families will donate 20 horses to 20 new families through Heifer’s Pass on the Gift (POG) model. In addition, original and POG project participants, as well as 100 individual participants who will not receive livestock will be trained in Heifer’s 12 Cornerstones for Just and Sustainable Development, horse husbandry, horse trekking, ecotourism development, guesthouse operations and tourism service provisions. The trainings will be especially useful for project participants who already own horses but lack the necessary knowledge in ecotourism to run horse trekking businesses on their own.
